Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk kmod-redhat-qed
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: new packages: kmod-redhat-qed, kmod-redhat-qede, and kmod-redhat-qedf
Vulnerability.Description:
New kmod-redhat-qed, kmod-redhat-qede, and kmod-redhat-qedf packages are now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. The kmod-redhat-qed package that contains the core kernel module for the QLogic FastLinQ 4xxxx series hardware adds support for the new QLogic FastLinQ devices, specifically: QLogic FastLinQ 41000 Series Controller
The kmod-redhat-qede package that contains Ethernet Driver for the QLogic FastLinQ 4xxxx series hardware adds support for the new QLogic FastLinQ devices, specifically: QLogic FastLinQ 41000 Series Controller
The new PCI IDs supported by this package are: 1077:8070 FastLinQ QL41000 Series 10/25/40/50GbE Controller 1077:8090 FastLinQ QL41000 Series Gigabit Ethernet Controller (SR-IOV VF)
The kmod-redhat-qedf package contains FCoE Driver for the QLogic FastLinQ 4xxxx series hardware, and provides support for the QLogic FastLinQ devices with FCoE functionality, specifically: QLogic FastLinQ 41000 Series Controller QLogic FastLinQ 45000 Series Controller
The PCI IDs supported by this package are: 1077:8080 FastLinQ QL41000 Series 10/25/40/50GbE Controller (FCoE) 1077:165C FastLinQ QL45000 Series 40GbE Controller (FCoE)
The kernel modules delivered by this erratum have been made available as part of the Red Hat Driver Update Program, which provides updated kernel modules that add support for selected devices in advance of the next Red Hat Enterprise Linux minor update release. We strongly recommend that these kernel modules be only used when it is necessary to enable the specific hardware mentioned in this erratum. Partners and customers should continue to use the driver that is shipped in the latest Red Hat Enterprise Linux kernel for all other devices that require this driver. (BZ#1448408, BZ#1448409, BZ#1448411)
All users who require kmod-redhat-qed, kmod-redhat-qede, and kmod-redhat-qedf are advised to install these new packages.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
